ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The class provided a great deal of insight into assessing and discussing international issues, including global poverty, war, and immigration. The course did a fair job of presenting both sides of the argument, explaining the strengths, weakness, and pitfalls of each author/concept.
General knowledge of the philosophy surrounding global affairs.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Weakness: very philosophical, not grounded in real-world application until the final weeks of the course

Strength: relevant and interesting topic selection

Strengths: Very engaging material, the professor is extremely knowledgeable on the topic

Weakness: Readings were not talked about enough in class which led to difficulty in understanding the readings. Learning expectations weren't clear. The learning environment was not facilitative of student learning and it was hard to engage in class.
I did not understand anything said in the Lectures, content is unsearchable online to understand it better.
If you are interested in philosophy, this is an easy class to excel in. However, the title of the class is very misleading-- it is all ethics, and no international affairs.

There was too strong a focus on ethical content and too little focus on international affairs to justify the title Ethics & International Affairs. Additionally, to be truly well prepared for this course one should have at least a working knowledge of ethics as just a background in International Affairs is not sufficient.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: No, I was constantly stressed and anxious about my performance in class and during exams and papers. I have never felt stupid in a class before taking this course, and despite trying, the professor did not help.
I would recommend this course to someone who really is interested in ethics and has already taken some ethics classes.
